    # Haskell

    æˆ‘ä»¬å°†ç”¨ Cons æ›¿æ¢ (ğŸ˜ƒ æ„é€ å™¨ï¼Œç”¨ Nil æ›¿æ¢ [] æ„é€ å™¨ï¼š

    data List a = Cons a (List a)
            | Nil
              deriving (Show)

    è®¾è®¡ä¸€ä¸ªå‡½æ•°èƒ½å¤Ÿæ¥å—ä»»ä½•ä¸€ä¸ª [a] ç±»å‹çš„å€¼ä½œä¸ºè¾“å…¥å‚æ•°ï¼Œå¹¶è¿”å› List a ç±»å‹çš„ä¸€ä¸ªå€¼ï¼š

    fromList (x:xs) = Cons x (fromList xs)
fromList []     = Nil

    ä¼ å…¥ä¸€ä¸ª List a ç±»å‹çš„å€¼ï¼Œè¿”å›ä¸€ä¸ª [a]:

    toList :: List a -> [a]
toList Nil = []
toList (Cons x xs) = x : toList xs

    ä»¥ä¸Šæ˜¯ haskell çš„é€’å½’ç±»å‹çš„å®ç°ã€‚èƒ½å¦ç”¨ swift ä»£ç å®ç°ï¼Ÿ

    # Swift

    indirect enum List<T: CustomStringConvertible>: CustomStringConvertible {
    case null
    case cons(T, List<T>)
    
    init(list: [T]) {
        if list.count == 0 {
            self = .null
        } else {
            let trail = Array(list.suffix(from: 1))
            self = .cons(list[0], .init(list: trail))
        }
    }
    
    var description: String {
        switch self {
        case .null:
            return "null"
        case let .cons(a, b):
            return "cons(\(a), \(b.description))"
        }
    }
    
    func toList() -> [T] {
        
        switch self {
        case .null: return []
        case let .cons(a, b):
            return [a] + b.toList()
        }
    }
}

let elist: List<Int> = .init(list: [1,2,4,5])
let list = elist.toList()

print(elist)
print(list)
